what: Extract REDCap Databases into Tidy Tibbles
title: Extract REDCap Databases into Tidy Tibbles
text: REDCap powerful database solution used many research institutions: ‚ÄúREDCap secure web application building managing online surveys databases. REDCap can used collect virtually type data environment (including compliance 21 CFR Part 11, FISMA, HIPAA, GDPR), specifically geared support online offline data capture research studies operations.‚Äù goal REDCapTidieR provide users simple API extracting REDCap databases turning tidy tibbles. makes easily joinable tables data necessary specific REDCap forms, instead singular complex table typically received single export. REDCapTidieR great use databases using: Repeating Instruments Longitudinal Events Longitudinal Arms Much inspiration package derived wonderful work done REDCapR package.

title: Extract REDCap Databases into Tidy Tibbles
text: can install development version REDCapTidieR like :

title: Extract REDCap Databases into Tidy Tibbles
text: üöß Development üöß Using main function simple requires REDCap URI API token read/write privileges: sample output containing repeating instruments may look like: contents redcap_data contain data associated form:
code: redcap_export <- read_redcap_tidy(redcap_uri, token) redcap_export # A tibble: 3 √ó 3   redcap_form_name redcap_data  structure      <chr>            <list>       <chr>        1 repeated         <df [9 √ó 6]> repeating    2 nonrepeated      <df [8 √ó 5]> nonrepeating 3 nonrepeated2     <df [3 √ó 5]> nonrepeating redcap_export$redcap_data %>% pluck(1) record_id redcap_repeat_instance redcap_event redcap_arm repeat_1 repeat_2 1         1                      1      event_1          1        1        2 2         1                      2      event_1          1        3        4 3         1                      3      event_1          1        5        6 4         1                      1      event_2          1        A        B 5         1                      2      event_2          1        C        D 6         3                      1      event_1          1        C        D 7         3                      1      event_2          1        E        F 8         3                      2      event_2          1        G        H 9         4                      1      event_3          2       R1       R2

what: Bind REDCap Tidy Tibbles to Specified Environments ‚Äî bind_tables
title: Bind REDCap Tidy Tibbles to Specified Environments ‚Äî bind_tables
text: Supply read_redcap_tidy() output load REDCap data tables specified environment locations.

title: Bind REDCap Tidy Tibbles to Specified Environments ‚Äî bind_tables
code: bind_tables(   .data,   environment = global_env(),   redcap_form_name = NULL,   structure = NULL )

title: Bind REDCap Tidy Tibbles to Specified Environments ‚Äî bind_tables
text: .data tidy table provided read_redcap_tidy() environment environment assign tidy data (default global_env()). new environment, recommended use rlang::new_environment(). redcap_form_name Specify REDCap form names load environment. Default behavior forms. structure Specify REDCap structure load environment, either repeating nonrepeating. Defaults structures.

what: Extract REDCap Databases to Tidy Tibbles ‚Äî read_redcap_tidy
title: Extract REDCap Databases to Tidy Tibbles ‚Äî read_redcap_tidy
text: Automatically detect REDCap database structure following elements: Repeat Instruments Longitudinal Events Longitudinal Arms Output tibble list elements containing tidy dataframes. Ideal combination tables join operations primary composite keys.
